messages.content:
Here's an attempt of initiating a `Field` from a 32 elements array of `number`.
```typescript
const data_field: Field = Field.fromBytes([
        36,  82, 100,  67, 50, 238, 187,  94,
        163,  23,  79, 203, 23,  36, 178, 184,
        130, 106,  96,  13, 68,  85, 182,  94,
        58, 147,  96, 157, 88, 174, 128, 198
    ]);
```
it raises
```
    RuntimeError: unreachable

      at __rust_start_panic (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:3312693)
      at rust_panic (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:3307369)
      at std::panicking::rust_panic_with_hook::hb01d8793e567b040 (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:3117430)
      at std::panicking::begin_panic_handler::{{closure}}::h60108af06f38ef3d (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:3238474)
      at std::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_end_short_backtrace::h761906d06428c797 (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:3303652)
      at rust_begin_unwind (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:3285422)
      at core::panicking::panic_fmt::hffbf0f027a7fa92d (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:3299960)
      at core::result::unwrap_failed::haf3f6481b8d95ef1 (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:3264758)
      at <plonk_wasm::arkworks::pasta_fp::WasmPastaFp as wasm_bindgen::convert::traits::FromWasmAbi>::from_abi::h663aac302268cfb2 (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:2752067)
      at caml_pasta_fp_to_bigint (wasm:/wasm/00e653d2:1:2261046)
```
in SnarkyJS `0.7.3`

Sorry, I think I confused the fact that Field can store 64 bits, not 64 bytes... Am I correct?
```typescript
const data_field: Field = Field.fromBytes([
        36,  82, 100,  67, 50, 238, 187,  94
    ]);
```
this is fine
field = 32bytes
weird... then why it won't cast, maybe the value exceeds the max Field?
base58 `3SnYbQym9awSs3dTJVcDTJ5AVPXYgfca1u43Y7VgHPYy` or hex `2452644332eebb5ea3174fcb1724b2b8826a600d4455b65e3a93609d58ae80c6`
this is 32 bytes, I am trying to make a Field out of it
Field = 255 bits actually… not quite 32 bytes
it seems like a bug, so I opened a ticket https://github.com/o1-labs/snarkyjs/issues/641

embeds.title: converting large 32 byte values to Field fails · Issue #641 · o1-la...
embeds.description: example value as hex 2452644332eebb5ea3174fcb1724b2b8826a600d4455b65e3a93609d58ae80c6 as base58 3SnYbQym9awSs3dTJVcDTJ5AVPXYgfca1u43Y7VgHPYy as bigInt 8978530373669178484708609268852610275569460936...

messages.content: ok, so value needs to be strictly less than `2^255-1`, the decimal of `2452644332eebb5ea3174fcb1724b2b8826a600d4455b65e3a93609d58ae80c6` is `16428835994624346447986401719261838890560271134332071947330393459106438348998` just need to check if it exceeds it
docs says that so just reposting

From the docs: 
> For the cryptography inclined, the exact max value that a field can store is: 28,948,022,309,329,048,855,892,746,252,171,976,963,363,056,481,941,560,715,954,676,764,349,967,630,336
I agree that your number is smaller
@renzokuken when you do `const data_field: Field = Field.fromBytes([36,  82, 100,  67, 50, 238, 187,  94]);` does it return the right value based on what you expect?
yes, if I put 31 bytes instead of 32 it is fine
problem is my Field will contain a bech32 decoded GRIN address which is 32 bytes, so because of this one byte I need to use two Fields to store it...
The error could be a bit more explanatory, I have to admit :x
But yes, 255 bit arent quite 32 bytes - theres a few disadvantages that come with it, e.g. your address not fitting into one field

Seems y'all have figured it out, but for future readers: the field element that the bytes represent needs to be less than the field modulus for `Field.fromBytes` to work. A method to pack bytes into the smallest number of field elements possible is `Encoding.Bijective.Fp.fromBytes`
(as opposed to `Encoding.bytesToFields` which just uses 31 bytes per field element)
